author: Undecided with Matt Ferrell
description:
Why Nothing Is Truly Waste Anymore. To get your very own Segway Navimow X350 go to https://bit.ly/3GZnOCn. When we talk about the circular economy, we picture batteries stripped for their metals, factory floor scraps spun into sweaters, and agricultural waste transformed into biogas. We don’t picture mucking out the barn to collect material for surgical masks and food packaging. Waste may be used in new household products. It’s now possible to spin it into high-tech, biodegradable plastics and textiles or use it as glue inside lithium battery electrodes. And as for the urine we send down the drain, it might someday help build our cities with better concrete. So, is this the next leap in sustainable design — or just a steaming pile of hype? And how close are we to building a cleaner, greener future from human and animal waste?

Watch Why Mushrooms are Starting to Replace Everything https://youtu.be/jI2LC3WTryw?list=PLnTSM-ORSgi7uzySCXq8VXhodHB5B5OiQ

title: Why Nothing Is Truly Waste Anymore
